intro: Cystoathyrium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their distinctive, palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, greenish or yellowish flowers. They are typically herbaceous perennials that thrive in moist, shaded environments. Cystoathyrium species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
